description: THE SKY IS FALLINGHow Vampires, Zombies, Androids, and Superheroes Made America Great for ExtremismBy Peter Biskind252 pp. The New Press. $26.99.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: A Dark Cavalcade of New Horror Fiction
description: The strongest emotion we feel is fear, and the strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown. I am paraphrasing H. P. Lovecraft, a founding father of American horror, who died in 1937, but this sentiment is very much relevant today. Fear. The gasp as your plane hits turbulence and drops; the creeping sensation as the front door squeaks open in the middle of the night; the shudder when you hear the dentists drill buzz  we all know fear in some form or another. Fear drives us to do things we might never have considered doing, or to become someone we didnt plan to be. Fear forces us to choose between safety and risk. And this, of course, is the stuff of great fiction.

title: Graphic Novels to Give Kids Chills and Thrills
description: All adolescents face two monsters: insecurity about where they are now, and the stress of impending adulthood. Fantasy writers have long asked us to imagine how tough that would be if supernatural forces were also in the mix. Two new graphic novels spin enthralling tales of young heroes slaying those inner beasts  right along with the kind that suck your blood and try to kill you.

title: Misfits, Stalkers and Kiddie Sociopaths: The Latest Thrillers
description: Its been 30 years since the publication of Thomas Harriss The Silence of the Lambs, the suspense novel that pitted the F.B.I. trainee Clarice Starling against the serial killer Hannibal Lecter, showcased them as they bored into each others psyches and did more to change the genre than any novel until Gillian Flynns Gone Girl a generation later. To revisit The Silence of the Lambs today is to encounter a story that shows its age  not just because of the of-its-era language in which transgender issues are discussed, but because it is something that too few thrillers dare to be in 2018: strictly linear.

title: From Stephen King, Master of Darkness, a Light New Tale
description: ELEVATIONBy Stephen King146 pp. Scribner. $19.95.

title: Hunting Down the Best True-Crime Tales
description: Put a pile of anything in front of me  shoes, seashells, books  and Ill robotically start organizing them into categories. It soothes my mind to separate, say, con artists from gangsters, and it makes a jumble of true-crime books on a variety of topics easier to tackle. But since the ones right in front of me are about serial killers, lets start with those.

title: New in Paperback: To Siri With Love, The Relive Box
description: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.

title: Susan Orlean Burned a Book. It Was Excruciating.
description: PLAYING WITH FIRE Early in The Library Book  about the suspicious fire that roared through the Los Angeles Central Library in 1986  Susan Orlean decided she needed to see what it felt like to burn a book.

title: Should Tech Giants Like Google Be in the Business of Teaching Children How to Be Good Digital Citizens?
description: Should internet companies like Google be in the business of teaching children how to be good digital citizens? Or is Google not the most trustworthy source when it comes to giving advice on how to navigate the internet safely?

title: How Gardening While Black Almost Landed This Detroit Man in Jail
description: DETROIT  For nearly two years, a man tilled an overgrown park in a half-abandoned Detroit neighborhood into a tiny urban farm, filling the earth with the seeds of kale and spinach and radishes. He was black.

title: Family History in Her Bones
description: I hold my 4-year-old daughters hand as she lies on the cold surface of the X-ray table, watching her brow furrow as she concentrates on holding her left ankle at the awkward angle in which the technician placed it. This is, for her, an exciting experience, something about which she feels only curiosity.

title: Should I Get the High-Dose Flu Vaccine?
description: Q. If the high-dose flu vaccine is more potent, why do I have to wait until Im 65 to get it?

title: A Family Reunion, Centuries Later
description: Family reunions can be touching or tense, joyous or fractious. But they are almost always complicated.

title: Looking at Songs That No Longer Seem Quite So Romantic
description: Pay close attention to the lyrics of familiar pop songs, and the ingrained cultural attitudes toward women become all too clear.

title: A.I. Is Helping Scientists Predict When and Where the Next Big Earthquake Will Be
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Countless dollars and entire scientific careers have been dedicated to predicting where and when the next big earthquake will strike. But unlike weather forecasting, which has significantly improved with the use of better satellites and more powerful mathematical models, earthquake prediction has been marred by repeated failure.

title: Just in Time for Halloween, a Graphic Homage to a Classic Work of Gothic Horror Literature
Weekly Health Quiz: Organic Food, Risky Weather and Cancer
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: Rebuilding After a Hurricane: Why Does It Take So Long?
description: Six years after Hurricane Sandy, there are still about 2,000 households mired in the rebuilding process.

title: Out of the Gallery, Into the Street
description: A massive Anish Kapoor sculpture integrated into the base of a TriBeCa building. Custom works by Robert Indiana and Olafur Eliasson featured at a condominium opening next year in Miami. And three artistic takes on the traditional scale model by the kinetic sculptor Es Devlin, which take up prime space in the sales gallery for the XI, a residential tower south of Hudson Yards in New York.

title: Restoring the House the Ringling Circus Built
description: Sarasota, Fla.  In the 1920s, John Ringling and his wife, Mable, built their dream house in Sarasota, Fla.: a 56-room Venetian Gothic palazzo named Ca dZan, or House of John.

title: Prez Art Museum Miami Recalls Pink Islands
description: MIAMI  It might have been the first time a traffic jam in South Florida ended in smiles. On the afternoon of May 7, 1983, cars began to slow down on the causeways that sail over Biscayne Bay and connect Miami Beach with the mainland. Many motorists stopped altogether, hopping out onto the road for a better look at the surreal sight in the bay: 11 small, uninhabited islands were newly surrounded by 6.5 million square feet of pink woven polypropylene fabric, each looking like a 200-foot-wide, pastel-colored lily pad, shimmering in the tropical sunlight.

title: New Sentences: From Dungeons & Dragons Art & Arcana
description: From Dungeons & Dragons Art & Arcana: A Visual History (Ten Speed Press, 2018, Page 173), by Michael Witwer, Kyle Newman, Jon Peterson and Sam Witwer.

title: Breast-Feeding Is Good for the Mother, and Not Just the Baby
description: Most women know breast-feeding is good for their babies health. But doctors and midwives rarely tell moms-to-be that its also good for nursing mothers.

title: Readers Respond to the 10.14.2018 Issue
description: Re: The Walmart of Heroin

title: Jersey City Grows Up
description: When Zacheus and Ratri Chan showed up at an open house for a townhouse in the Bergen-Lafayette neighborhood of Jersey City last fall, there was a line down the street.

title: Japans Leader Goes to Beijing. Heres Whats at Stake.
description: TOKYO  Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan is in Beijing for a three-day visit, the first Japanese leader to make an official trip to China in nearly seven years. The visit represents a chance to move beyond the tense relations between the two countries in recent years and their history of hostilities. Mr. Abe reached trade deals with China and committed to stable relations in a day of meetings Friday with President Xi Jinping and Premier Li Keqiang.

title: How a Hugely Popular Pretzel Bun Became a Political Minefield
description: By virtue of its near constant appearance on Instagram, the pretzel bun on the burger at the Emily restaurants, as they are known, stands as a celebrity carbohydrate, and like all celebrities, it is both worshiped and detested.

title: CBS Inquiry Into What Went Wrong in Les Moonves Era Hits Snags as It Advances
description: The #MeToo movement may have affected the CBS Corporation more than any other mass media company over the past year. After The New Yorker and The Washington Post published articles detailing accusations against high-ranking men at the network, CBS parted ways with Leslie Moonves, its chief executive; Jeff Fager, the longtime executive producer of 60 Minutes; and Charlie Rose, one of its best known anchors.

title: Exhibitions in Qatar Celebrate Syria Before the War
description: DOHA, Qatar  A thousand miles southeast of what remains of Syrias civil war, Syria Matters, a major exhibition at the Museum of Islamic Art here, is focused on the history and the soul of the country rather than the images of conflict that have been reflected in headlines and splashed across television screens for the past seven years.

title: House and Senate Latest, Good News for Beto: 11 Days to Go
description: Welcome to The Tip Sheet, a daily political analysis of the 2018 elections, based on interviews with Republican and Democratic officials, pollsters, strategists and voters.

title: U.S. Economy Charged Ahead in the Third Quarter
description: The American economy barreled ahead in the third quarter as consumers stepped up and spent more, keeping it on track for the best annual performance since 2005.

title: The Auction Seasons Real Gems
description: Somewhere on a Gulf of Panama beach in the early 16th century, someone found a perfectly formed, pear-shaped 50-plus-carat pearl. Someone else named it la Peregrina (the Wanderer), and Mary Tudor of England received it as an engagement gift in 1554. (She was 38 and died four years later.)

title: Hungary Turned Far Right. Thats Meant Millions for Its Opera.
description: BUDAPEST  The grand, gilded Hungarian State Opera House here is where Brahms once heard Mahler conduct Mozart. Its where Bartoks still-shocking Bluebeards Castle had its premiere a century ago. Its where the artist Matthew Barney shot part of his Cremaster cycle, and Jennifer Lawrence filmed scenes for her violent thriller Red Sparrow, in which she played a ballerina-turned-spy.

title: How Julia Jordan, Champion of Female Playwrights, Spends Her Sundays
description: Julia Jordan writes plays, runs a non-profit organization, plays Sudoku obsessively, walks her dog and raises two kids in a Brooklyn house in mid-renovation. You could say shes earned a Sunday off.

title: After the Hurricane Came the Con
description: It was the giant whiteboard that did it, they said.

title: Rafael Lozano-Hemmer Is a Crowd Pleaser. Hes Also Obsessed With Death.
description: Can an artist be a creator of entertaining, technologically inspired, interactive creations that people line up to try, and be, at the same time, a somewhat macabre intellectual with a penchant for social criticism?

title: Will One State Go It Alone to Make Polluters Pay?
description: CENTRALIA, Wash.  The last coal mine in Washington State closed down about a decade ago in Centralia, about 65 miles south of Seattle, leaving scars on the land and the local economy. Now, a solar electricity project  perhaps the largest in the state  is planned for the same location, by the same company that once ran the mine.

title: New-York Historical Society Goes All Harry Potter
description: With its 38-foot-high ceiling, bookcases stuffed with faded, leather-bound volumes and walls festooned with oil portraits that seem to wink, the second floor reading room of the New-York Historical Society bears a striking resemblance to a certain fictional school for wizards.

title: The Ivy League Becomes the Future of Football
description: HANOVER, N.H.  The earliest football game between two eventual members of the Ivy League took place when Columbia played Yale in 1872. Dartmouths football team had its first intercollegiate game in 1881, several years before the sport was formally introduced at Ohio State and Alabama.

title: The Return of the Vampire King of New York
description: In the dim corner of Halloween Adventure, a two-story costume store in Manhattan, a man called Father Sebastiaan sculpts vampire fangs by hand. A Ouija board hangs crooked on the wall, near a purple crystal and an uneven pile of occult books. His work stall, no larger than a broom closet, is barely visible behind pirate and cowboy masks.

title: A Day on the Road With the Migrant Caravan
description: The political frenzy is heightening over a so-called migrant caravan heading toward the United States, but who are the people making the grueling journey? We spent 24 hours with a family as they trekked through Mexico for an up-close view of whats at stake.

title: The Tragedy of Saudi Arabias War in Yemen
description: The Khashoggi killing has cast light on Saudi tactics in Yemen, where an economic war has pushed millions to the brink of starvation.

title: Why We Are Publishing Haunting Photos of Emaciated Yemeni Children
description: Amal Hussain is a 7-year-old Yemeni girl with a haunting gaze whose image sits atop our latest report from Yemen, a country plunged into war and on the brink of a catastrophic famine.

title: Pipe Bombs, Google, Megyn Kelly: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Falling Stars Challenge Takes the Humble Out of Humblebragging
description: Flaunting your wealth on social media usually looks a tad more subtle than this.

title: As China Rattles Its Sword, Taiwanese Push a Separate Identity
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  With greater frequency, China is using its growing air and sea power to try to intimidate Taiwan, the self-ruled island that it hopes to annex. China has also weaponized its economic prowess to induce foreign companies and even governments to erase Taiwans international presence.

title: Loss Across and Love Down
description: Crossword puzzles are opportunities for collaboration and friendly competition. Conquering a crossword puzzle with a friend creates a sticky fiber that binds two people together.

title: They Saw a Sign and Didnt Shake It Off
description: For much of the last three years, Mariano Rivera III and Alyssa Picinich were kept apart by Mr. Riveras first love.

title: New York Today: A Bomb-Carrying Truck
description: Good morning on this nebulous Friday.

title: The Voters Both Parties Are Ignoring
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Can Colorado Save America?
description: NUCLA, Colo.  Richard Craig, gun lover, Trump hater, is the man behind the local ordinance here that made gun ownership obligatory for the head of every household. The unusual rule, approved overwhelmingly by the town board in 2013, has gained this small community in southwestern Colorado some notoriety. I believe in our Constitution, Craig told me. Having our guns is just part of American freedom. As for President Trump, I think hes an idiot. He should quit tweeting and keep his mouth shut.

title: Erdogan Demands that Saudis Tell Turkey Who Ordered Khashoggi Killing
description: ISTANBUL  President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said Friday that Turkey had uncovered further evidence in the killing of the Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, pressing Saudi Arabia to reveal who gave the orders and demanding that its leaders explain what happened to Mr. Khashoggis body.

title: DealBook Briefing: Googles #MeToo Moment
description: Good Friday. Want this by email? Sign up here.

title: Vatican Faces Modern-Day Suffragists, Demanding Right to Vote
description: VATICAN CITY  Two modern-day American suffragists had a plan.

title: Baseballs Defensive Dance: How the Dodgers and Red Sox Use the Shift
description: The infield defensive shifts have become a mainstay in baseball. But the Dodgers and the Red Sox use them very differently.

title: Horror, Horror, Read All About It
description: For scary-movie lovers, the 1980s were a golden decade. The horror scene exploded so much after the original Halloween (1978) proved so popular that titles like The Dorm That Dripped Blood, The Mutilator and Deadtime Stories were being advertised in the mainstream pages of The Times, The Daily News and The New York Post.

title: The Week in Arts: Pistol Annies New Album; Return of House of Cards
description: Nov. 2; itunes.apple.com.

title: What Debra Messing Cant Travel Without
description: Debra Messing has starred in television shows and movies for decades, but the actress is best known for playing Grace Adler in Will and Grace, which ran on NBC from 1998 to 2006 and which the network brought back to TV screens last year. The sitcoms new season had its premiere on Oct. 4.

title: In London, a Restaurant Specializes in Indian Home Cooking
description: When she moved from India to England in 1991, Asma Khan studied British constitutional law  but she could barely boil an egg. I struggled a lot because I didnt know how to cook, she said. England was a foreign land. Nothing was in my control. But I realized I could infuse my house with the aromas of home. For two summers she returned to India to learn the recipes of her mother and grandmother. And with her new skill, came a vision: Every time I slept at night, I dreamed I was feeding people, she said.

title: Afghan War Casualty Report: Oct. 19-25
description: The following reports compile all significant security incidents confirmed by New York Times reporters and stringers throughout Afghanistan. It is necessarily incomplete as many local officials refuse to confirm casualty information.

title: Republicans for Democrats
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive the newsletter each weekday.

title: Shinzo Abe Says Japan Is Chinas Partner, and No Longer Its Aid Donor
description: BEIJING  It has been eight years since China overtook Japan as the worlds second-largest economy. Yet the Japanese government continued to provide China with development assistance usually reserved for poorer countries. Until now.

title: Theres Much Talk About Latino Voters, but Are Campaigns Talking to Them?
description: Good morning.

title: Behind the Clash Over Italys Budget, a Fear of Populism
description: BRUSSELS  Just a few years ago, the European Union faced down a populist Greek government whose debts threatened the common currency, the euro, and the very integrity of the bloc.

title: So Much for the Starter House
description: Johanna Lasser had lived in a dozen apartments before she bought her first house two years ago, a rundown Victorian in Ditmas Park, Brooklyn. Ms. Lasser and her husband, Jimm, figured they would fix it up, stay a few years and then move on to a house in the suburbs, or one in a better school district, as many people do.

title: The Week in Tech: Apple Goes on the Attack
description: Each week, technology reporters and columnists from The New York Times review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. Want this newsletter in your inbox? Sign up here.

title: Suspiria Then and Now: Finding Darkness in an All-Female World
description: When Dario Argentos German-set horror movie Suspiria came out in 1977, Berlin was on edge. Demonstrators angry at the West German government and what were seen as the depredations of capitalism hit the streets. The far-left guerrilla group the Red Army Faction terrorized the city in what would become known as the German Autumn, leaving several dead. It was also a key period for the assertion of feminist power and female liberation. The Red Army counted women among its leaders, and one of the first feminist magazines in Germany, Emma, published its inaugural issue that year.

title: Outspoken Trump Supporter in Florida Charged in Attempted Bombing Spree
description: An outspoken supporter of President Trump from South Florida was charged on Friday with sending explosive packages to at least a dozen of the presidents critics, apparently bringing to a close an attempted bombing spree that has gripped the country just ahead of the midterm elections.

title: Behind LeBron James, Lakers Push the Pace to Victories
description: LOS ANGELES  The Lakers are off and running. No, really. They are running. And running. And running some more.

title: A Cabaret in Hungary Asks a Horrific Question: What if Jews Vanished?
description: BUDAPEST  What would happen if Jewish people suddenly disappeared?

title: For Transgender Americans, the Political Gets Even More Personal
description: Gender Letter helps you keep up with the world  and the women and issues shaping it. Tell me what you think at dearmaya@nytimes.com.

title: Trumps Trade War May Create New Auto Jobs. In China.
description: President Trump has said he started a trade war to create jobs in America. But foreign carmakers that employ thousands of workers in the United States are gauging whether tariffs, the main weapon in that war, may compel them to shift jobs to, of all places, China.

title: Jamie Lee Curtis: Im Waving the Banner for Generations of Women
description: Jamie Lee Curtis has many reasons to be grateful this year. She turns 60 on Thanksgiving, and shes currently celebrating the monster success of Halloween. The new sequel to John Carpenters 1978 original earned $76.2 million in its first weekend  the biggest opening for a horror movie with a female lead and for any film starring a woman over 55.

title: Silicon Valley Nannies Are Phone Police for Kids
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Silicon Valley parents are increasingly obsessed with keeping their children away from screens. Even a little screen time can be so deeply addictive, some parents believe, that its best if a child neither touches nor sees any of these glittering rectangles. These particular parents, after all, deeply understand their allure.

title: In The Black Cat, the Titans of Terror, Karloff and Lugosi, Face Off
description: Now considered a classic, The Black Cat (1934) was the first movie to feature Universals two prized assets, Boris Karloff and Bela Lugosi, and the studios excitement was palpable. Its the monster of Frankenstein plus the monster of Dracula, plus the monstrousness of Edgar Allan Poe, the ads boasted, all combined by the master makers of screen mysteries to give you the absolute apex in super-shivery.

title: Hugh Jackman Breaks the Movie Star Rules and Doesnt Care
description: Some celebrities revel in the spotlight; others, not so much. Hugh Jackman falls into the first category, as witnessed when he recently settled into a well-positioned banquette in a West Village restaurant and faced his dining audience, the better to disarm and dazzle.

title: In Homecoming, a Sound Experiment Becomes Something to See
description: UNIVERSAL CITY, Calif.  What do you see? If youre listening to Homecoming, the cult hit podcast from Gimlet Media, the answer is nothing. A psychological thriller set largely inside a mysterious corporate facility somewhere in Florida, the podcasts story is relayed strictly through sound, even more so than other fictional podcasts of late, or the cliffhanger-loving radio dramas that preceded them. Seemingly cobbled together from found recordings of phone calls and therapy sessions, theres not even a narrator to tell you where you are, or when.

title: The Digital Gap Between Rich and Poor Kids Is Not What We Expected
description: The parents in Overland Park, Kan., were fed up. They wanted their children off screens, but they needed strength in numbers. First, because no one wants their kid to be the lone weird one without a phone. And second, because taking the phone away from a middle schooler is actually very, very tough.

title: A Dark Consensus About Screens and Kids Begins to Emerge in Silicon Valley
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The people who are closest to a thing are often the most wary of it. Technologists know how phones really work, and many have decided they dont want their own children anywhere near them.

title: Stacey Abrams, a Daughter of the South, Asks Georgia to Change
description: THOMASVILLE, Ga.  Lets say you were making a TV movie about Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor in the reliably Republican state of Georgia. Where would you begin?

title: How to Work a Night Shift
description: Beware of the deep dark, says Teresa Wren, who has worked the night shift for 30 years as a labor-and-delivery nurse at the University of Washington Medical Center in Seattle. With sufficient sleep during the day, you can stay alert, but youll have to get through a wave of fatigue between 2 a.m. and 4 a.m. Take a short nap if you can. Wren warns against eating unhealthful snacks or candy to stay awake; her go-to weapons against the darkness are one caffeinated diet soda per night and a walk up and down the external stairwell in the cool air.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Leftover Bagel Ownership
description: Jessica writes: Recently, I brought home three bagels from an office gathering. My boyfriend, Kelly, was going to take one for his lunch, but our dog stole it. So Kelly took the remaining two bagels (one plain, one Asiago) and is still annoyed at having lost a bagel. I pointed out that it had been a net gain, as technically all three were mine. Whos right?

title: Thanksgiving Is Coming
description: Good morning. The emails are starting to come in now from friends, the texts, the direct messages, the phone messages left in consideration and in haste: Just checking in about Thanksgiving. Had a couple questions.

title: U.K. Apologizes for Visa Letters Demanding Immigrants Submit a DNA Test
description: LONDON  Britains home secretary has apologized to hundreds of immigrants who were illegally forced to provide DNA samples as part of a visa application process to settle in the country.

title: Im a Child of Immigrants. And I Have a Plan to Fix Immigration.
description: An immigration lawyer once told me bluntly: Immigration is a wedge issue.

title: Abroad in America: What Is Firing Up Female Candidates?
description: Welcome to The New York Timess international election newsletter, where Sarah Lyall tries to explain the U.S. midterm elections to readers outside the United States (and perhaps to herself). Eleven days to go.

title: Silicon Valley Cant Escape the Business of War
description: The sunny precincts of Silicon Valley have been wrestling for months with the question of whether technology companies should stay out of work related to the military. Google recently announced that it would no longer compete for a $10 billion Pentagon cloud computing contract. Microsoft employees have pressured its chief executive to do the same.

title: BTS Conquered America. Whats Next for K-Pop?
description: This year, BTS became the first K-pop act to debut atop the Billboard album chart, and recently concluded its American tour with its first sold-out stadium show in the United States, at Citi Field in Queens. The groups rise has been rapid, and obliterated all previous notions of how far a Korean-speaking act can go in the U.S. It also reflects a K-pop audience that is widening and maturing, here and around the world.

title: White Briton Filmed Hurling Racist Abuse on Ryanair Flight Says Hes Not Racist
description: LONDON  A white British man who was filmed shouting racist abuse at a black woman in a Ryanair plane in Spain apologized in a TV interview on Friday and said that he had lost his temper, a bit, and that he was not a racist person by any means.

title: New Daily Show Correspondent Graduated From Twitter
description: Age: 24

title: Trumps Complaint: Bomb Plot Coverage Overtakes His Campaign Rhetoric
description: WASHINGTON  When President Trump took the podium in the East Room on Friday, he opened with a solemn expression of gratitude to the F.B.I. and other law enforcement agencies for arresting a suspect in a bomb plot against prominent Democrats and other critics of him.

title: Death Toll in Jordan Flood Reaches 21, but Grief Quickly Turns to Anger
description: JERUSALEM  Grief at the death of 21 people, mostly schoolchildren, in a flash flood near the Dead Sea in Jordan turned to anger on Friday as the Jordanian government said that the school that organized the trip may not have had the proper permits.

title: Stocks Resume Slide, Pulling S.&P. 500 Briefly Into a Correction
description: Disappointing earnings reports from the tech giants Amazon and Alphabet set off another turbulent day on Wall Street on Friday, and the benchmark stock-market index briefly dipped into a correction.

title: Mild Cauliflower Makes for an Easygoing Dinner Partner
description: I love the versatility of the unassuming cauliflower. In vegetable terms, its a blank canvas. Thats not to say its flavorless, but cauliflowers relatively mild personality is ready to be transformed in combination with a vast number of other flavorful ingredients. Its nature is to absorb and comply.

title: After the Royal Wedding, a Gospel Choir Hits the Big Time
description: LONDON  Karen Gibson wanted some silence. She was standing before the Kingdom Choir, the gospel ensemble she founded and has led for more than 20 years, during a recent rehearsal at a church in the London neighborhood of Pimlico. The group had just been working on a version of All of Me, made famous by John Legend, and a couple of dozen singers were enjoying a rambunctious moment of downtime.

title: New Type of Credit Score Aims to Widen Pool of Borrowers
description: Consumers with less-than-stellar or borderline credit scores may soon have a new option to help them qualify for loans and credit cards.

title: He Almost Couldnt Walk His Daughter Down the Aisle. What Is Causing His Leaden Feet?
description: It started as a feeling of pins and needles in his feet. Now hes struggling to walk. Can you help?

title: FIFA Averts Institutional Crisis by Delaying Major Vote
description: KIGALI, Rwanda  Gianni Infantino, the president of FIFA, backed down on Friday from plans to hold a vote on the creation of two new competitions that would have meant profound changes for global soccer after he was told that they would lead to an institutional crisis for the sport.

title: Libraries, Writ Small
description: Todd Bol was simply paying homage to his mother, a schoolteacher and lover of books. He built a doll-size schoolhouse, filled it with his mothers books and put it out for his neighbors in Hudson, Wis., as a book exchange.

title: From Walking Dead Casualty to South Korean Cinema Star
description: When Glenn Rhee, the scrappy pizza deliveryman turned warrior on The Walking Dead, became another casualty of that AMC series, Steven Yeun, the actor who played him, already felt he had outgrown his character. But like Donnie Yen, Joan Chen and other Asian-American performers before him, he had to look outside Hollywood to find three-dimensional roles that defied stereotypes and caricatures.

title: A Stir-Fry That Brings Out the Best in Green Beans
description: Green bean season is shorter than my list of ways to prepare them. Before I can cycle through the dozen or so dishes, its time to move on to wintry brussels sprouts and cabbage.

title: Netflixs Audience Is Multiplying. But So Is Its Debt.
description: Netflix, the streaming-video juggernaut, is growing with astonishing speed. And if you ignore the fact that it borrows billions to finance that growth, the company is a classic success story.

title: Why The Times Is Covering the Caravan
description: Several readers have written to The Times asking why news organizations like ours are covering the caravan of migrants from Central America making their way toward the United States. These readers argue that President Trump is focusing national attention on the caravan as a political tactic ahead of the midterms, and that The Times should not be helping such efforts by devoting coverage to it.

title: The Playlist: Cardi B Hits Pay Dirt, and 11 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: Last-Minute Meals
description: Hi and welcome to Five Weeknight Dishes, delicious recipes you can make on a Tuesday  but actually I also make them on Saturdays. Last weekend, a group of my closest friends came over for dinner, one of those things that miraculously comes together sort of at the last minute. I got to the store that afternoon and put a sheet pan full of chicken thighs in the oven just after my daughter went to bed. (I did chicken thighs rather than a whole chicken because theyre fast, everyone likes them and I barely have to think about them, since they cook evenly and are so forgiving.)

title: Review: A New Conductor Inspires the Orchestra of St. Lukes
description: Connoisseurs love to talk about the distinct sounds of different orchestras. But theres art in versatility, too  in the ability of a group of players to adapt, chameleon-like, to the demands of the given music and conductor.

title: Living in a Van Plastered With Hate, Bombing Suspect Was Filled With Right-Wing Rage
description: AVENTURA, Fla.  On Twitter, Cesar Sayoc Jr. lashed out at immigrants, gun control advocates, and prominent Democratic politicians. On Facebook, he misspelled a racial epithet, directing it at the likes of Oprah Winfrey and former President Barack Obama.

title: Man Arrested in Britain on Suspicion of Trying to Damage Magna Carta
description: LONDON  A man was arrested on Thursday in connection with the vandalism of a glass display case at the cathedral in Salisbury, England, housing an original Magna Carta, one of the worlds most revered legal documents.

title: 50 Years Later, a Victim of Irelands Laundries Fights for Answers
description: DUBLIN  For 30 years, she struggled with secret memories of beatings and other abuses, as well as most of the classic symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder: chronic anxiety, social isolation, compulsive behavior, depression, flashbacks, nightmares and suicidal thoughts.

title: Youve Become Rich. That Doesnt Mean Youre Great at Everything.
description: In allowing the best competitors to rise to the top in our market economy, we allow enormous wealth to concentrate in relatively few hands. The competition that produced Apple, Tesla and Google has also produced billionaires.

title: Review: In Ordinary Days, a Sweet Escape to the Recent Past
description: Every time I think about Ordinary Days, Adam Gwons chamber musical about four New Yorkers longing for meaningful connection, Stephen Sondheims song Another Hundred People starts playing in my head.

title: Brett Howden Stands Out in the Rangers Youth Movement
description: In a rebuilding season in which they have struggled to score and win in regulation time, the Rangers are a work in progress, with a shifting lineup from game to game.

title: Midterm Election Poll: Pennsylvanias 1st District, Fitzpatrick vs. Wallace
description: After the redrawing of the Pennsylvania congressional map in February, the new First District preserves the core of Pennsylvanias Eighth and keeps Bucks County intact. But it now adds more Democratic territory from central Montgomery County, so going by 2016 results, its now a Clinton-leaning district instead of a Trump-leaning one.

title: Cicely Berry, Who Taught Actors Shakespeares Sound, Is Dead at 92
description: Cicely Berry, whose unorthodox exercises released actors minds to feel the sound and muscularity of Shakespeares verse for nearly a half-century as the Royal Shakespeare Companys voice director, died on Oct. 15 in Cornwall, England. She was 92.

title: Midterm Election Poll: North Carolinas 9th District, Harris vs. McCready
description: This Republican-leaning district stretches from central Charlotte to rural, traditionally Democratic and majority black areas of eastern North Carolina.

title: Why Private Equity Is Furious Over a Paper in a Dermatology Journal
description: Early this month, a respected medical journal published a research paper on its website that analyzed the effects of a business trend roiling the field of dermatology: the rapid entrance of private equity firms into the specialty by buying and running practices around the country.

title: Surprise Mahler: The Week in Classical Music
description: [Read all of our classical music coverage here.]

title: Crazy Tender Chicken in Only an Hour
description: Many people assume, based on what I do for a living, that I must have an extraordinary kitchen full of the latest tools and appliances. The reality here is that I have cooked with the same beat-up Dutch ovens for years, have a stove that is basically an Easy-Bake Oven, and only last year decided it was time to buy a blender (that honestly I have used only once).

title: Facebook Removes Iranian Network That Was Spreading Disinformation
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Last year, when Facebook disclosed a sweeping, coordinated disinformation campaign carried out by Russian agents, the company presented the first evidence of a new kind of information warfare.

title: Matthew Shepard Laid to Rest at National Cathedral Decades After His Murder
description: It took decades to find a safe place for the remains of Matthew Shepard, whose murder in 1998 as a 21-year-old college student turned him into a symbol for violence against gay people.

title: As Merkel Weakens, One German Election Takes On New Importance
description: FULDA, Germany  It is telling of the flagging strength of Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany that when she showed up this week to lend support to her party in Hesse before bellwether elections on Sunday, she all but urged voters not to consider her.

title: Megyn Kellys Crash at NBC in One Word (Hers): Wow
description: The four days that sank Megyn Kelly and sparked a vicious standoff inside NBC News began with a simple, cheery welcome to her Today show audience.

title: Trump Considering Executive Actions to Stop Asylum Seekers From Central America
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump is considering a major speech on Tuesday to announce a broad crackdown on the southern border, administration officials said Friday, making a significant play to energize his anti-immigrant base one week before midterm congressional elections where Republican control of Congress is at stake.

title: Smart-Home Devices to Make Your Holidays Easier
description: All the holiday planning, coordinating, decorating and entertaining can sap some of the enjoyment out of a season that should be full of cheer. Although people may not immediately associate the holidays with technology, in many ways smart-home devices can take a bit of the stress and worry out of the season by doing some of the more mundane (and necessary) work for you.

title: 3 Ways to Create a Climate Change Investment Strategy
description: The United Nations released a sobering report on climate change this month, stating that the Earth is warming faster than even scientists thought and that without far-reaching action, the planet is likely to warm to a dangerous level by 2040.

title: A Clueless Remake and More: 7 Things to Know From the Week in Pop Culture
description: What would you like to see here? Email us at popculture@nytimes.com.

title: She Made the Shift From Academic Writing to Hallmark Cards
description: Melvina Young, 55, is a senior writer at Hallmark Cards in Kansas City, Mo.

title: Great Ad. Compelling Characters. But No Mass Audience for the Democratic Candidates.
description: WASHINGTON  It is one of the more compelling ads of the midterm election cycle, a 60-second video featuring eight Democratic women running for House seats, reciting their backgrounds in either the military or intelligence services as the predicate for their first runs for political office. Bruce Springsteens anthemic The Rising soars in the background.

title: Ireland Voters to Decide on New President and Old Anti-Blasphemy Law
description: DUBLIN  As an academic, poet, intellectual, committed socialist and famously pause-averse public speaker, Irelands president, Michael D. Higgins, is far from your typical crowd-pleasing candidate.

title: The Best and Worst of This Weeks Trailers: Mrs. Maisel Is Back!
description: Rebels abound in this weeks batch of new trailers, from Lenny Bruce (the taboo-busting mentor of The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel) to Robert the Bruce (the rabble-rousing subject of Outlaw King).

title: Courting Black Voters in a Race to Be New Yorks First Black Attorney General
description: It should have been an easy swipe at an opponent.

title: A Family Affair in the Bronx
description: Weekly specials play a major role at Ajo y Organo: Any day you go, the menu is a tease of what might have been.

title: At Ajo y Organo, Big Flavors Flow From a Small Space
description: If its Friday, there will be rabo encendido, oxtails dark as ink from a simmer in Presidente beer and Brugal rum. This is lunch and event at once, and may explain the crowd that forms before noon on the rainbow-planked porch outside Ajo y Organo, a tiny gasp of a restaurant in Parkchester, the Bronx, between a tire shop and a barbers.

title: Review: The Chilling Adventures of Sabrina Pits Teenage Rage Against Dark Magic
description: The Chilling Adventures of Sabrina is frequently chilling, but its rarely much of an adventure. Netflixs new spin on the lore of Sabrina the Teenage Witch, starring Kiernan Shipka (Mad Men) as our spooky heroine, gets off to a spellbinding start, but over 10 episodes becomes more toil and trouble than its worth.

title: Turkey: World Leader in Jailing Journalists
description: To the Editor:

title: What Would You Tell Your 18-Year-Old Self?
description: For a project to document the lives of 18-year-old girls around the world, we asked readers to share their best advice for 18-year-old them. We heard from Hillary Clinton, Chelsea Handler and the Nobel Prize nominee Amanda Nguyen  as well as thousands of readers. From New Jersey to Argentina, heres their best wisdom, along with photos of themselves at 18.

title: The Health Insurance Squeeze
description: To the Editor:

title: Gilberto Benetton, 77, Dies; Expanded Family Clothing Company
description: ROME  Gilberto Benetton, who drove the expansion of the family clothing business known for its colorful sweaters and provocative advertisements into investments in agriculture, real estate, highways and other nonwoolen enterprises, died on Monday in Treviso, Italy. He was 77.

title: Microsoft Says It Will Sell Pentagon Artificial Intelligence and Other Advanced Technology
description: REDMOND, Wash.  Microsoft said on Friday that it would sell the military and intelligence agencies whatever advanced technologies they needed to build a strong defense, just months after Google told the Pentagon it would refuse to provide artificial intelligence products that could build more accurate drones or compete with China for next-generation weapons.

title: Its an Exodus
description: CIUDAD HIDALGO, Mexico  The long line of men and women waded into the muddy waters of the Suchiate River. Holding onto a rope, they pulled themselves over the invisible line dividing Guatemala and Mexico. Others crossed with their babies and young children on crowded rafts built with tires.

title: Sri Lanka Faces Constitutional Crisis as President Unseats Prime Minister
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Sri Lanka plunged into a constitutional crisis Friday after the president ousted the prime minister, a move that took the nation by surprise and was denounced as illegal by some government ministers.

title: Sandra Day OConnor: A Trailblazer and My Mentor
description: To the Editor:

title: Brazils Markets Have Surged on Hope of Bolsonaro Victory. Can He Deliver?
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Looking at Brazils rallying stock market and stronger currency, it might seem as if Jair Bolsonaro, the right-wing presidential candidate favored by investors, had already won and the country was bouncing back from its painful recession.

title: Lisa Brennan-Jobs on Small Fry
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music | How to Listen

title: Ruth Bader Hat Guy? Let Our Algorithm Choose Your Halloween Costume
description: Machine learning has a spooky side. These algorithmically generated Halloween costumes show how artificial intelligence can reinforce human bias.

title: A White Van Laden With Stickers Is at Center of Bombing Investigation
description: AVENTURA, Fla.  One sticker has a Photoshopped image of President Trump standing on a tank, haloed by fireworks with an American flag behind him. Dishonest Media, and CNN Sucks, reads another one, the cable networks logo affixed to it. And then there are the memes expressing support for the president and animosity toward his critics.

title: Why Are We Still Teaching Reading the Wrong Way?
description: Our children arent being taught to read in ways that line up with what scientists have discovered about how people actually learn.

title: The New Boss Isnt Working Out. Should You Go Over His Head?
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com, including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: An Insiders View of the New York Public Library
description: Michele Coleman Mayes is the general counsel of the New York Public Library.

title: Clashes Blocking Women From Temple in India Bring Over 2,000 Arrests
description: NEW DELHI  As India grapples with questions of how much government institutions should be involved in religious affairs, a violent war of wills playing out over womens access to one of Hinduisms most important temples has led to the arrest of more than 2,000 people this past week, the police said on Friday.

title: They Were Sent Pipe Bombs. Heres What Trump Said About Them  and What They Said About Trump.
description: One called him a danger to the world. Another said he was drunk on power. A third even refuses to call him the president. This week, packages containing crude pipe bombs were sent to these critics of President Trump and several others.

title: Why You Shouldnt Wait to Sign Up for Medicare Part B
description: Twenty years ago, George Zeppenfeldt-Cestero left his job as a hospital administrator in New York to open a one-person health care consulting firm.

title: Signs of Economic Trouble We Shouldnt Ignore
description: To the Editor:

title: G.O.P. Hypocrisy About Trumps iPhone
description: To the Editor:

title: Bomb Suspects Arrest
description: To the Editor:

title: Galas for Arts and Design
description: Fund-raisers were held for Lincoln Center, Studio Museum in Harlem, the Harlem School of the Arts and the Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum.

title: Epic, Maker of Fortnite, Raises $1.25 Billion
description: Fortnite has become one of the biggest video game sensations in the world. Now its maker, Epic Games, is cashing in.

title: Review: Renascence Introduces a Thoroughly Modern Millay
description: A portrait of the artist as a young hottie, the Transport Groups Renascence is a superheated strings-heavy biomusical devoted to the early adulthood of the poet Edna St. Vincent Millay. It takes its title from the perfervid 1912 lyric that thrust its winsome author to the center of the literary scene. Carmel Deans melodies, passionately sung, make the poems soar. But what does it mean that I came out of the show liking Millays poetry a lot less than when I went into it?

title: As Midterms Near, Trump Talks of Closing the Border
description: To the Editor:

title: Alley Oop Will Return (Spoiler Alert)
description: The comic strip Alley Oop, starring a loin-cloth-wearing cave man of the same name, went into hibernation in September but will be back in January.

title: A Volcanic Eruption on Mars? Nope
description: A photograph from a spacecraft orbiting Mars shows a long, white wisp, close to a thousand miles long, spilling out of a giant volcano.

title: Israeli Prime Minister Visits Oman, Offering a Possible Back Channel to Iran
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu returned to Israel from Oman on Friday, the first such visit by an Israeli prime minister in 22 years and a sign of closer ties for Israel with an influential Persian Gulf nation that has long acted as a regional go-between.

title: The Migrant Caravan: What to Know About the Thousands Traveling North
description: PIJIJIAPAN, Mexico  For two weeks, throngs of people have trudged north, crossing first from Honduras into Guatemala and then on to Mexico, bound for the United States border. They have spent nights in sprawling makeshift camps or in churches and schools, washing their clothes in rivers and relying on donations from locals.

title: The Local Issues Our Readers Care About
description: Hi. Welcome to On Politics, your guide to the day in national politics. Im Lisa Lerer, your host.

title: For Over a Decade, This Base Has Housed American Soldiers Rotating Through Afghanistan
description: At War is a newsletter about the experiences and costs of war with stories from Times reporters and outside voices.

title: Kirk Gibsons Home Run Ball Is Still Gone, Probably Forever
description: LOS ANGELES  What baseball fan has not seen video of Kirk Gibson pumping his arm while limping around the bases after smashing one of the most memorable home runs in the sport?

title: Obama, Rallying in Wisconsin, Warns Democrats: Dont Be Hoodwinked
description: MILWAUKEE  Former President Barack Obama criticized what he called Republican hypocrisy on Friday during a rally with Democrats in Wisconsin, claiming that conservatives have shown themselves not to be trusted on issues ranging from health care to national security and the deficit.

title: Pipe Bomb Arrest, Yemen, Midterms: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Republicans Look to Safety Net Programs as Deficit Balloons
description: WASHINGTON  With the federal deficit growing and President Trump suddenly talking about another tax cut, the conversation in Washington has turned to the inevitable question of how  or whether  Congress will engage in any type of fiscal discipline.

title: Migrants Reach a Crossroads in Mexico, Far From the Raging Debate
description: ARRIAGA, Mexico  The thousands of migrants traveling through southern Mexico toward the United States border poured into the rail town of Arriaga on Friday, filling the towns main park and the surrounding streets, clustering together in spare shade under a torridly hot sun.

title: Google Workers Fume Over Executives Payouts After Sexual Harassment Claims
description: SAN FRANCISCO  At Googles weekly staff meeting on Thursday, the top question that employees voted to ask Larry Page, a co-founder, and Sundar Pichai, the chief executive, was one about sexual harassment.

title: The Barbarians Are Within
description: I have been reading J.M. Coetzees novel Waiting for the Barbarians. It concerns a magistrate, a servant of Empire, stationed on a remote frontier, who watches with mounting indignation as fear of barbarian encroachment is used to justify a brutal and self-defeating imperial campaign of violence and torture. It is a portrait of an aging man, stung by his conscience, bewildered by his times.

title: In This World Series, the Ballparks Play a Starring Role
description: BOSTON  So often in sports, the stage is simply that  the theater in which players perform. Sure, a stadium allows for atmosphere, but only in the sense that the audience has to sit somewhere, and if teams can park fans into gilded suites, ply them with $15 beers and assault their senses with bright lights and thumping music, well, all the better.

title: Tyrone Gayle, 30, Spokesman for Senators and Hillary Clinton, Dies
description: Tyrone Gayle, the Washington press secretary for Senator Kamala Harris and a veteran of Democratic campaigns, died on Thursday in Manhattan. He was 30.

title: New York Times Endorses John Brooks, James Gaughran and Andrew Gounardes
description: The state legislative races on November ballots can be like the filet of sole on a steakhouse menu  not what most people are looking for. Yet, though the governors race, and even congressional races, will draw the greatest interest on Nov. 6, elections for the New York State Senate are unusually important this year and deserve New Yorkers full consideration.

title: Trump Doesnt Have to Answer Questions About Multiple Sexual Harassment Claims, Judge Rules
description: Summer Zervos had hoped her defamation lawsuit against President Trump might become a platform for other women who, like her, have accused the president of sexual harassment.

title: Democrats Have Numbers on Their Side in Battle for the House. Republicans Have the Map.
description: Dozens of House races remain extremely close in the closing days of the midterms, according to New York Times Upshot/Siena College polls, making it easy to envision a Democratic blowout or a district-by-district battle for control that lasts for weeks of counting beyond the election.

title: Rapper 6ix9ine Sentenced to Probation in Sex Video Case
description: Saying that the rapper Daniel Hernandez had engaged in acts of unsolicited generosity and expressed genuine remorse for his actions, a justice on Friday spared him from prison in connection with sexually explicit videos he made with an underage girl.

title: The Bomb Suspects Van Is Covered With Stickers. Heres What They Show.
description: Federal law enforcement officials seized the van of Cesar Sayoc Jr., who was arrested in connection with the wave of bombs sent to prominent Democrats and critics of President Trump. Heres why the van could be key to the investigation.

title: Londons King of Retail Fashion, Brought Low by #MeToo
description: Among the purse-lipped patricians of Buckingham Palace, Sir Philip Green stood out a mile.

title: Baseball Has a Rorschach Test: The Checked Swing
description: BOSTON  J.D. Martinez stepped back from home plate, lifted his head toward the sky and rolled his eyes in exasperation. It was the eighth inning of Game 1 of the American League Championship Series against the Houston Astros, and Martinez, the Boston Red Sox slugger, had just been called out for a swinging strike three, even though he insisted he had successfully checked his swing.

title: Quotation of the Day: President Weighs Use of Executive Actions to Turn Back Migrants
description: The caravan represents such a minuscule number of people coming toward our border that it just strains credulity to say that this is a national emergency that demands immediate action.

title: To Cast Their Ballots, These Voters Will Have to Get Out of Dodge
description: DODGE CITY, Kan.  On Election Days past, voters cast their ballots at the only polling place in this town of 27,000: the sprawling civic center on the north side of Dodge City. But with a construction project expected to start there soon, the county clerk moved the polls this year almost four miles away, past the railroad tracks and beyond the city limits.

title: A #MeToo Story in Britain Prompts Debate Over Privacy Laws
description: LONDON  A debate over press freedom, the right to privacy and the validity of nondisclosure agreements has erupted in Britain in recent days after a court upheld an injunction barring The Daily Telegraph from publishing accusations of misconduct against a British businessman, Sir Philip Green.

title: As Baseball Fills Leadership Jobs, Everybody Loves the Rays
description: LOS ANGELES  When Nathan Eovaldi joined the Boston Red Sox this summer, his old team was a source of curiosity in his new clubhouse. Eovaldi had pitched for the Tampa Bay Rays, baseballs most innovative think tank. The Rays did not reach the playoffs, but their surprise 90-win season commanded attention.

title: Federal Government Tells Catholic Bishops Not to Destroy Sex Abuse Documents
description: The Department of Justice has sent a sweeping request to every Roman Catholic diocese in the United States not to destroy documents related to the handling of child sexual abuse, a sign that the federal investigation into the church could grow far more extensive.

title: Before Cesar Sayoc Was a Bombing Suspect, He Was a Trump Superfan
description: Cesar Sayoc Jr., the suspect arrested by the authorities in connection with a series of bombs sent in the mail, appears to be an outspoken supporter of President Trump.

title: On Foot and Underground at Canadas Crossroads
description: There were a few unpredictable outcomes in the recent flurry of municipal votes around the country. In Vancouver, Kennedy Stewart, a former New Democrat member of Parliament, squeaked in as mayor. And after quitting as leader of Ontarios Progressive Conservatives following sexual misconduct allegations, Patrick Brown is now the mayor of Brampton, Ontario, a fast-growing Toronto suburb that he only recently began to call home.

title: Disaster Candidates Beyond Trump
description: Perhaps this will go down as The Year Two Indicted Congressmen Ran for Re-election.

title: Trump, at Charlotte Rally, Tries to Rebuild Political Momentum by Reviving Old Attacks
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  For two days, the president toyed with a bipartisan message and watched as the news cycle focused not on him, and not on the midterm elections, but on at least 14 explosive devices delivered to prominent Democratic figures.

title: Corrections: October 27, 2018
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Clocked
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE   Its neurotic to personalize every little thing, isnt it? Were all doing the same puzzle. But the chill is real here in New York, and I have an inordinate amount of wrinkled winter clothing and (for some weird reason) clumps of dog hair on every flat surface in my house, and somehow overnight my hibernatory genes have seized control of my metabolism. So ouch to 1A, Mr. Walden.

title: Photo of a Starving Girl in Yemen Prompts Facebook to Remove Posts of Article
description: For a few hours after The New York Times published an article about conflict and hunger in Yemen, Facebook temporarily removed posts from readers who had tried to share the report on the social platform.

title: Midterm Election Poll: Californias 45th District, Walters vs. Porter
description: This often-redrawn district in Orange County, once a pillar of the Reagan-era Republican Party, has experienced an influx of Asian-American and Latino voters. Although some suburban voters may be uneasy with President Trump, the district is not exactly liberal.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: The Post and Girl From Nowhere
description: Steven Spielbergs The Post premieres on HBO. And the Thai series Girl From Nowhere comes to Netflix.

title: On Politics: The Biggest Stories of the Week
description: From explosive devices sent to the presidents critics to an increasingly partisan divide ahead of the midterm elections, its been a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the biggest stories you might have missed (and some links if you want to read further).

title: Salvini Seizes on 2nd Italian Teenagers Death to Push Immigration Issue
description: ROME  Jackal! the activists shouted as Matteo Salvini, the strongman of Italys populist government, arrived at the other end of the street. Jackal!

title: World Series: Dodgers Defeat the Red Sox in a Marathon Game 3
description: LOS ANGELES  The baseball postseason had never seen anything like it.

title: Why Textbooks May Need to Update What They Say About Birth Canals
description: Look up the term pelvic canal in the typical anatomy or obstetric textbook, and you likely will find a description such as this: Well-built healthy women, who had a good diet during their childhood growth period, usually have a broad pelvis.

title: Marijuana Legalization Has Gone Mainstream. Rick Steves Has Helped.
description: The legalization of marijuana is a more mainstream issue now than it has ever been. That trend is both reflected and powered by the advocacy of people like Rick Steves, the mild-mannered travel writer and host of Rick Steves Europe, who campaigned for legalization in his home state of Washington in 2012 and now travels the country doing the same thing.

title: Today, for the First Time, I Donated Money to a Campaign
description: With less than two weeks to go before Americas midterm elections, congressional candidates in the 69 most competitive House races have raised hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: Mexico Should Not Consent to Do Washingtons Dirty Work
description: A migrant caravan from Honduras is marching north through Mexico.

title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads
description: Welcome to the weekend. Are you cleaning out the closets? Listening to the radio? Wherever your weekend takes you, be sure to make time for some fantastic journalism.

title: Hotel Review: In Newport Beach, Calif., Bucking the Tide
description: From $300

title: Urban Planning Guru Says Driverless Cars Wont Fix Congestion
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  Peter Calthorpe thinks Silicon Valley has it all wrong. He rejects the ideas of tech industry visionaries who say personal autonomous vehicles will soon be the solution to urban problems like traffic congestion.

title: They Dont Have Money: Greeces Prostitutes Hit Hard by Financial Crisis
description: ATHENS  A prospective client walked into the narrow, dimly lit room in the basement of a broken-down building in central Athens. Elena, 22, took off her robe and stood up. Evaggelia, her 59-year-old, fiery-tempered madam, immediately went into her pitch.

title: After Teacher Walkouts, Arizona Republicans Jostle Onto Education Platform
description: PHOENIX  Campaign signs are clustered on street corners and highway ramps across this low-slung, sun-baked city, proclaiming #YesforEd and Protect Public Education. In TV commercials, the Republican governor promises to put more money in the classroom, not bureaucracy. Our schools are falling apart, his Democratic challenger counters.

title: Anne Lamott, Lefty Guru of Optimism
description: FAIRFAX, Calif.  Anne Lamott thought Doomed was a pretty good name for her latest book, but it was a hard sell to the powers that be at Riverhead, her longtime publisher, so she settled on a less apocalyptic title, one she couldnt quite remember on this bright Northern California afternoon. Something  Anything? she said.

title: Red-Hot Economy? Women Arent Convinced
description: A remarkable gender gap has opened up in Americans views of their own finances and the broader national economy.

title: Amanda Peet Struggles With Her Tennis Game
description: Amanda Peets first ball smacked right into the net. So did the second. The third? That one whammed right into the groin of the Sanjin Kunovac, her tennis coach.

title: Why Is CBD Everywhere?
description: Its hard to say the precise moment when CBD, the voguish cannabis derivative, went from being a fidget spinner alternative for stoners to a mainstream panacea.

title: Saudi Arabia Rejects Turkeys Extradition Request in Khashoggi Killing
description: MANAMA, Bahrain  Saudi Arabias foreign minister on Saturday rejected a call by President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey to try the suspects in the killing of the dissident commentator Jamal Khashoggi in that country, saying that the men arrested would be prosecuted on Saudi soil.

title: Sri Lankas President Suspends Parliament, Escalating Political Crisis
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka  President Mathripala Sirisena of Sri Lanka on Saturday suspended Parliament for two weeks as he sought to shore up support for unseating the countrys prime minister, escalating a political crisis.

title: Mets Negotiating to Make Brodie Van Wagenen Their General Manager
description: The Mets have done a lot of business in recent years with Brodie Van Wagenen, a prominent agent who has worked for Mets players such as Jacob deGrom, Yoenis Cespedes, Brandon Nimmo and Todd Frazier.

title: Mail Bombs and Other Threats Have the Wealthy Cranking Up Security
description: In recent years, the unpredictability of terrorizing events has kept Americans on alert, wary of threats to their safety and well-being.

title: Bomb Suspect, Beto Poll, Obama Calls Out Trump: 10 Days to Go
description: Welcome to The Tip Sheet, a daily political analysis of the 2018 elections, based on interviews with Republican and Democratic officials, pollsters, strategists and voters.

title: Shopping for Insurance? Dont Expect Much Help Navigating Plans
description: WASHINGTON  When the annual open enrollment period begins in a few days, consumers across the country will have more choices under the Affordable Care Act, but fewer sources of unbiased advice and assistance to guide them through the labyrinth of health insurance.

title: He Had Her With Sincere Hug-Hello
description: Jessica Lauren Pantzer and Scott Ryan James were married Oct. 27 at the Wagner at the Battery, a hotel in New York. Rabbi Linda Henry Goodman officiated.

title: A No on Kavanaugh Yields a Windfall for Heitkamps Campaign Coffers
description: WASHINGTON  After Senator Heidi Heitkamp of North Dakota announced that she would not vote to confirm Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court, sympathetic voters went to work to show their support for the embattled red-state Democrat, writing letters of thanks and posting their appreciation on social media.

title: 2 at Takeout Restaurant in U.K. Are Convicted of Manslaughter in Nut Allergy Death
description: LONDON  The owner of a take-away restaurant and a deliveryman in Britain have been found guilty of manslaughter for delivering food to a teenage girl who died from the effects of a peanut allergy.

title: They Escaped Chinas Crackdown, but Now Wait in Limbo
description: GAVLE, Sweden  Abdikadir Yasin and his wife waited for months, dreading a call telling them they would have to leave Sweden and return to western China, where the government has corralled hundreds of thousands of Muslim Uighurs like them into re-education camps.

title: Taiwans Gay Pride Parade Draws Thousands, as Votes on Same-Sex Marriage Near
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  A year ago, participants in Taipeis annual gay pride parade  the biggest event of its kind in East Asia  had a lot to celebrate.

title: Red Sox Waste Nathan Eovaldis Sterling Relief Effort
description: LOS ANGELES  On Friday afternoon, a few hours before the start of Game 3 of the World Series, Nathan Eovaldi appeared at a news conference as the Red Sox projected starting pitcher for Game 4. That was the plan, though it was subject to change. It was quickly becoming clear, even then, that everything in the Series was subject to change.

title: I Cant Afford My Rent Anymore. What Happens if I Break My Lease?
description: Q: My husband and I rent an apartment on Roosevelt Island for $6,000 a month. Weve encountered some financial setbacks recently due to my unpaid maternity leave and changes to my husbands salary, leaving us unable to afford our rent. But we still have 18 months left on the lease. When we spoke with the management company, they said they would only let us out of the lease if we were able to reassign it to someone else, which would be difficult. What would be the worst-case scenario if we simply broke the lease and moved?

title: Oaxacan Rap Has a Female Voice, Finally
description: This is who I am, rapped Gloriel Villalobos, 26, known as Doma, standing in a circle with four other female rappers in Oaxaca, Mexico. A portable speaker blared an instrumental beat as the women took turns rapping.

title: Are the Danes Melancholy? Are the Swedes Sad?
description: The recent report by the White House Council of Economic Advisers on the evils of socialism has drawn a great deal of ridicule, and rightly so. It boils down to something along the lines of You want Medicare for All? But what about the terrible things that happened under Mao Zedong? Thats barely a caricature.

title: Fall Pastas Youll Want to Make All Season Long
description: Fall demands comforting recipes, so were thinking about pasta. Make a version with sausage, squash and sage brown butter (above); Korean bulgogi Bolognese or any of the recipes in the collection below.

title: Republicans Rushing to Save House Seats From Onslaught of Democratic Money
description: CINCINNATI  As the 2018 midterm campaign enters its final full week, House Republicans are rushing to fortify their defenses in conservative-leaning districts they thought were secure, pouring millions of dollars into a last-minute bid to build a new firewall against Democrats.

title: Mattis Vows U.S. Will Hold Khashoggis Killers Accountable
description: MANAMA, Bahrain  The United States is committed to holding accountable those responsible for killing the Saudi dissident Jamal Khashoggi, whose death undermines regional stability, Defense Secretary Jim Mattis said on Saturday.

title: 11 Killed in Synagogue Massacre; Suspect Charged With 29 Counts
description: PITTSBURGH  Armed with an AR-15-style assault rifle and at least three handguns, a man shouting anti-Semitic slurs opened fire inside a Pittsburgh synagogue Saturday morning, killing at least 11 congregants and wounding four police officers and two others, the authorities said.

title: A Fate Worse Than Slavery, Unearthed in Sugar Land
description: The blood-drenched history that gave the city of Sugar Land, Tex., its name showed its face earlier this year, when a school construction crew discovered the remains of 95 African-Americans whose unmarked graves date back more than a century. The dead  some of whom may have been born in slavery  are victims of the infamous convict leasing system that arose after Emancipation. Southerners sought to replace slave labor by jailing African-Americans on trumped-up charges and turning them over to, among others, sugar cane plantations in the region once known as the Sugar Bowl of Texas.

title: Cesar Sayocs Path on Social Media: From Food Photos to Partisan Fury
description: Until 2016, Cesar Altieri Sayoc Jr.s life on social media looked unremarkable. On his Facebook page, he posted photos of decadent meals, gym workouts, scantily clad women and sports games  the stereotypical trappings of middle-age masculinity.

title: Midterm Election Poll: Kansas 2nd District, Watkins vs. Davis
description: This district includes most of eastern Kansas except for the core of the Kansas City metropolitan area. Like the rest of the state, it is strongly Republican-leaning, but the retirement of the incumbent, with no obvious G.O.P. successor, and a strong Democratic candidate have thrown the outcome into doubt.

title: Israel Accuses Iran of Ordering Palestinian Rocket Fire From Gaza
description: JERUSALEM  Israel accused Iran on Saturday of ordering attacks by the Palestinian militant group that took responsibility for a heavy barrage of rocket fire from Gaza overnight.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: ACROSTIC  Todays passage, from her book Venomous, is by Christie Wilcox, a writer with a Ph.D. in cell and molecular biology.  The excerpt contains an interesting factoid (and we all love those) about one of those fascinating primitive mammals in the Monotreme order, which split off from mammalian evolution more than 150 million years ago: the platypus, one of a tiny group of warm-blooded egg-layers that shamble around Australia as living fossils.

title: Yemens Humanitarian Crisis: How to Help
description: The unsettling images of emaciated children staring up from hospital beds drew strong reaction from readers this week when The New York Times published The Tragedy of Saudi Arabias War, an interactive article documenting the catastrophic effects of the civil war in Yemen.

title: Driven by Trump Policy Changes, Fracking Booms on Public Lands
description: CONVERSE COUNTY, Wyo.  The parade of trailer trucks rolling through Jay Butlers dusty ranch is a precursor to a new fracking boom on the vast federal lands of Wyoming and across the West.

title: How Weird Was Game 3 of the World Series? Lets Take a Look
description: LOS ANGELES  Game 3 of the World Series, an exhausting 3-2, 18-inning win by the Los Angeles Dodgers over the Boston Red Sox, was one of the zaniest games in World Series history. Here are some statistics related to Fridays game that stand out.

title: Cesar Sayoc, Mail Bombing Suspect, Found an Identity in Political Rage and Resentment
description: AVENTURA, Fla.  Cesar Sayoc Jr. was a volatile nobody desperate to become a somebody.

title: Italians Protest in Rome About Dismal State of the City
description: ROME  Thousands of Romans gathered in front of City Hall on Saturday morning to protest the state of the Italian capital, where garbage is piled high on pothole-filled streets that have become a hazard for cars but a haven for wild boars, and where public buses catch on fire.

title: Affirmative Action: Curse or Cure?
description: To the Editor:

title: Trump Calls for Unity After Synagogue Shooting, Then Swiftly Denounces Democrats
description: MURPHYSBORO, Ill.  President Trump said on Saturday that the hearts of all Americans are filled with grief after a mass shooting at a Pittsburgh synagogue left at least 11 people dead, and he called on the country to combat hate crimes together.

title: How Voter Suppression Could Swing the Midterms
description: In the weeks before an election, political campaigns are focused on getting voters to the polls  holding rallies, knocking on doors and making phone calls to make sure people show up.

title: Science Confirms It: People Are Not Pets
description: The field of social psychology is sometimes accused of doing no more than ratifying common sense, so its worth paying attention when its findings are genuinely surprising. Case in point: the discovery that when we are rewarded for doing something, we tend to lose interest in whatever we had to do to get the reward.

title: Discovering the Great Indoors
description: It is easy to think today that we know most of what there is to know about life on Earth. But most living things have yet to be discovered or named, much less studied. We are surrounded by our own ignorance. This is even true in the wilderness of our indoor spaces  our homes, schools, offices and other enclosed places. These, too, are terra incognita. But we can be the Darwins of our own basements, attics, bedrooms, kitchens and bathrooms. What we find is likely to surprise us.

title: Not Every C-section Is a Bad Birth Story
description: I had my first C-section in 2015. I had my second C-section in 2017. If I ever get pregnant again (shudder), Ill have a third.

title: I Believe in Ghosts
description: Two years ago, faced with the rising cost of living in the greater Boston area, my family decided to put our lots in together and buy a property that could accommodate my middle sister, Kerri; my mother; and my oldest sister, Kirsten, her husband and their two children. I live in New York, but I was a part of this too, if only because of that fantasy of every kid who has grown up poor  that I would know I was successful when I could buy my mother a house.

title: The Problem With the Wrong Kind of Trans Visibility
description: About a month ago, I was reading the new novel Lake Success, by Gary Shteyngart, when I came across a familiar trope.

title: Liberal Hypocrisy in College Admissions?
description: We progressives hail opportunity, egalitarianism and diversity. Yet heres our dirty little secret: Some of our most liberal bastions in America rely on a system of inherited privilege that benefits rich whites at the expense of almost everyone else.

title: Who Says Allie Kieffer Isnt Thin Enough to Run Marathons?
description: Allie Kieffer, one of the best Americans running the New York City Marathon next Sunday, spent a lot of her life feeling as if she didnt really fit in among the competition. She was good enough to land an athletic scholarship to college and hoped to continue running after graduating. But she wasnt as thin as the women she raced against. Her coaches  suggested she diet. She eventually gave in, and her body broke down.

title: Riling Up the Crazies
description: WASHINGTON  As long as Ive covered politics, Republicans have been trying to scare me.

title: How to Turn a Person Into a Voter
description: This month, we got on a bus with some colleagues and made our way to a senior center in Louisville, Ga., a quaint town about 50 miles from Augusta. The trip was part of a bus tour across the South to talk to black people about building political power.

title: Ireland Re-elects President and Rejects Blasphemy Ban
description: DUBLIN  Ireland re-elected its leftist president, Michael D. Higgins, to a second term and voted overwhelmingly on Saturday to remove a ban on blasphemy from the Constitution.

description: A gunman opened fire in a Pittsburgh synagogue on Saturday, leaving 11 people dead and six others injured.

title: Hoping for a Midterm Split Decision
description: Since the election of Donald Trump, the conservatives who opposed him in 2016 have increasingly divided into distinct camps  one group continuing to criticize him but still backing the institutional G.O.P., and the other following their anti-Trumpism into root-and-branch opposition to his party. This division extends to midterm attitudes: Some NeverTrumpers will cheer for every Republican defeat, while others pull for G.O.P. victories in exactly the way they would have in 2010 or 2014.

title: English Soccer Team Owners Helicopter Crashes After Game
description: MANCHESTER, England  A helicopter belonging to the owner of Leicester City, the English Premier League soccer club, crashed outside the clubs stadium on Saturday evening.

title: Match Play
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Welcome to any new Erik Agard groupies! As the rest of you may know by now, our charismatic constructor made a series of brilliant appearances on Jeopardy this past week and the Friday before, burying contestants with jaunty, deadpan, sartorially distinctive aplomb. I was transfixed.

title: A Massacre in the Heart of Mr. Rogerss Neighborhood
description: On a Saturday morning in March of 1997 I became a bat mitzvah at Tree of Life Synagogue in Squirrel Hill.

title: Used to Hearing Shabbat Shalom, a Historic Jewish Enclave Rings Out With Gunshots
description: PITTSBURGH  Saturday morning in Squirrel Hill has for more than 100 years meant certain familiar rituals. The handing out of prayer books as latecomers quietly arrive at temple, the genial shouts of Shabbat shalom across neighborhood streets as friends spot old friends after services.
